revised_title: Molecular Dimensions and Viscosity of Organic Compounds: Thiophen, Methylthiophen, Pyridine, and Thiazole
tldr: This article investigates the molecular dimensions and viscosity of organic compounds, including thiophen, methylthiophen, pyridine, and thiazole. The author measures their density, vapour pressure, viscosity, and surface tension to understand the effect of replacing methenyl-groups in the benzene ring. The results provide insights into the physical properties and molecular behavior of these compounds.
